args: So that's where Leonidas is staying.
All right. We'll wait here. Once everyone's\ngotten all settled in, our boss'll come out\nand give us the signal.
It would seem preparations are complete.\nLet the feasting begin!
Ha ha ha! This is a blast and a half.\nC'mon, you guys! Party hardy!
MAN, I'm stuffed. Couldn't eat another\nbite if my life depended on it.
(Heh heh... This is good.\nThese guys don't suspect a thing.)
(And how is our royal apostate doing?)
The banquet has only just begun, but I've\nhad my fill. Men, feel free to linger and\nenjoy yourselves to your hearts' content.
(He's going back to his room alone!)
Now's our chance! The guards are all\ndistracted, and Leonidas has retired alone!
You guys handle the soldiers.\nI'll take care of Leonidas!
Attack! Those soldiers are nothing now\nthat they're dis—
So it had to come to this...\nHow truly regrettable.
Is it not obvious? You walked into my\ntrap with frankly embarrassing aplomb.
I knew you were a traitor, Captain.
If you draw your sword by your sleeping\nmaster, he's bound to notice.
Wait... Don't tell me you were\nonly pretending to sleep!
Hmph. Rather slow to realize, this one.
But if you knew... Why didn't you\ntake me in right then and there?!
I only let you run free because I'd\nrealized you were not acting alone.
The banquet was nothing but a pretense\nfor luring you and your little friends out\nso I could catch you all in one fell swoop.
While you left to speak with your group, I \nordered the rest of the soldiers to pretend\nthey were distracted by the banquet.
We're ready for anything you throw our\nway! You won't be getting past us!
You were an upstanding subordinate.\nAt least, until my brother defeated me.

Thus do I offer a sliver of mercy. If you
surrender, I'll allow you to escape with
your lives. However, if you resist, I shall
give no quarter.
Hey, Boss? I don't think we're gettin' outta\nthis one...
Dammit... I thought you'd gone soft,\nbut your fangs are as sharp as ever!
So WHY, then?! If you're still this strong,\nwhy won't you rule with an iron fist the\nway you used to?!
If you can't figure that out for yourself,\nyou have no right to call yourself my\nsubordinate.
To think there really were people after\nPrince Leonidas's head, just as he\npredicted...

And what's worse, the Captain
was the one pulling all the strings!
When His Excellency first told us,
I couldn't believe my ears.
If I may ask, sir: when did you realize\nthere was someone coming after you?
I think it should be quite obvious.
I knew from the very start.
I'll say it once more, and never again:\nI have no interest in your ridiculous\nsummer dia—
Hold. Am I reading this right...?
Be careful, Leonidas! Your life is in danger!

I learned of it as I was on my travels with 
{player_name}. There is an interloper
within Valkaheim's palace walls. He and his
gang want to catch you unaware and kill you.
I figured this would be a way to bear the\nnews to you without anyone else knowing.\nI know, I know. What magnanimity!
However arrogant you may be, you are also\nquite capable. I look forward to seeing how\nyou clean this little mess up! Ha ha ha!
Pretty fantastic, eh? You must be awfully\njealous of what a great vacation I had!
I see. So that's what this was all about.
(I can only surmise that this letter is\nreferring to the Captain. Now it's\nall beginning to make sense.)
(Ever since what happened with my\nbrother, he's been acting quite suspicious.\nIt seems this is the cause.)
Fine. Just this once, I'll take your advice.
It was at that moment that I devised this\nplan to draw out these conspirators.

If I made them think I was lost in some
sort of summertime reverie, I knew they
would jump at the chance to attack me
as soon as the moment was right.
M-my word... So it wasn't just the banquet.\nThe whole vacation was part of your plan!
You truly are a genius!\nYour foresight is rivaled by none!
(You see this, Xander?\nThis is how I handle things!)
